applist.name: Destiny 2
applist.detailed_description:
Temporada das Profundezas

Destiny 2: Temporada das Profundezas já começou

Mistérios e aventuras aguardam sob as ondas de Titã.


Abismo Adentro

A lua desaparecida de Saturno voltou e está infestada de Possuídos e seres da Colmeia em busca de algo no fundo do mar de metano. Os Guardiões deverão segui-los até as profundezas para descobrir segredos antigos e aprender mais sobre as origens da Testemunha.


Recuperações 


Recupere a tecnologia da Era Dourada nas estruturas submersas da Arcologia em Titã. Explore o fundo do mar pela primeira vez ao enfrentar a Colmeia Luzente e uma variedade de inimigos em diversos confrontos imprevisíveis. 

Mergulhos nas Profundezas 

Mergulhe cada semana mais fundo no oceano de Titã para recuperar o poder necessário para se comunicar com uma misteriosa criatura que você descobriu. 


Pescaria 

A corrupção em Titã está se espalhando para além do planeta. Tente relaxar e se divertir enquanto pesca alguns espécimes no sistema solar. 


Fuzil Automático Exótico 

Adicione o catalisador e um ornamento de ranque 100 ao Centrífuso, ignore as medidas de segurança e bote os raios para quebrar. 


Ornamentos Universais 

Do vácuo sideral às profundezas do oceano, não há pressão capaz de deter este estilo. 

Progressão Melhorada 

Mais de 100 recompensas, incluindo amplificadores de EXP, engramas exóticos, materiais de aprimoramento, cosméticos e mais. 

Passe de Temporada 

Equipamento, EXP, recompensas! Obtenha o Passe de Temporada e desbloqueie imediatamente o novo fuzil automático exótico. Ganhe também um amplificador de EXP para acelerar os ranques sazonais e desbloqueios na trilha de recompensas. 

Pacote de Prata 


Adquira o Pacote de Prata da Temporada das Profundezas e receba um novo gesto lendário, além de 1.700 Pratas (1.000 + um bônus de 700 Pratas) para você usar na compra de temporadas, cosméticos e mais! Visite a aba Temporadas no jogo e use sua Prata para comprar a Temporada das Profundezas. Fale com o Mestre Rahool na Torre para desbloquear seu novo gesto.


Sobre o jogo

Mergulhe no mundo de Destiny 2 para explorar os mistérios do sistema solar e vivenciar combates de tiro em primeira pessoa. Libere poderosas habilidades elementares, colecione equipamentos singulares para personalizar o visual e estilo de jogo do seu Guardião. Vivencie a história cinematográfica de Destiny 2, missões cooperativas desafiadoras, e competições em diversos modos PvP, só ou com amigos. Baixe gratuitamente e escreva sua lenda nas estrelas.

Uma História Envolvente

Vocês são Guardiões defensores da Última Cidade da Humanidade, em um sistema solar sitiado por vilões infames. Mirem as estrelas e se oponham à Treva. Suas lendas começam agora.

Classes de Guardiões

Escolha entre os Titãs com suas armaduras, os místicos Arcanos ou os ágeis Caçadores.


Titãs
Disciplinados e orgulhosos, Titãs são capazes de ataques agressivos e defesas robustas. Incendeie seu martelo, rompa os céus com trovões e enfrente os inimigos de igual para igual. Sua equipe estará confiante sob a força do seu escudo.

Arcanos
Arcanos usam os mistérios do universo como armas para se sustentar e destruir seus adversários. Traga uma chuva de devastação sobre o campo de batalha e elimine as hordas inimigas em um piscar de olhos. Quem estiver ao seu lado conhecerá o verdadeiro poder da Luz.

Caçadores
Ágeis e audaciosos, Caçadores são ligeiros ao se movimentar e ainda mais para sacar suas armas. Dispare sua arma dourada sem parar, varra os inimigos como o vento, ou ataque direto das sombras Localize o inimigo, mire e termine a luta antes que ela comece.

Experiências Cooperativas e Competitivas no Modo Multijogador

Vários modos de PvE e PvP para você jogar com seus amigos e outros Guardiões — ou contra eles.


Multijogador Cooperativo
Aventuras cooperativas empolgantes aguardam com recompensas raras e poderosas. Mergulhe na história com missões, jornadas e patrulhas. Junte um pequeno esquadrão e garanta o baú no fim de um rápido Assalto. Ou teste as habilidades da sua equipe ao longo de incontáveis horas de incursão - o desafio definitivo para qualquer esquadrão. Você decide onde a sua lenda se inicia.

Multijogador Competitivo
Enfrente outros jogadores em batalhas livres de ritmo acelerado, arenas de equipe e competições híbridas de PvE/PvP. Marque competições especiais como a Bandeira de Ferro no seu calendário e ganhe edições limitadas de recompensas antes que acabem.

Armas e Armaduras Exóticas

Milhares de armas, milhões de opções. Descubra novas combinações de equipamentos e defina seu próprio estilo. A caça pelo arsenal perfeito começou.

applist.legal_notice:
Requer pelo menos 105 GB de espaço em disco a partir de 10 de novembro de 2020. Os requisitos de armazenamento estão sujeitos a aumento. Após 10 de novembro de 2020, acesse www.destinythegame.com/size-requirements para saber os requisitos atuais antes da compra. Armazenamento adicional pode ser necessário para instalação, recursos e atualizações, inclusive para baixar atualizações obrigatórias para continuar a jogar. Os usuários são responsáveis por taxas de internet banda larga, necessária. Pode haver cobranças adicionais por conteúdo e recursos online.

Destiny 2 pode conter figuras e imagens reluzentes que podem causar reações adversas para uma pequena porcentagem de pessoas sensíveis a esse efeito.

O uso do software constitui a aceitação do Acordo de Licenciamento de Programa em www.bungie.net/sla. A Bungie pode modificar ou descontinuar serviços online sem aviso a qualquer momento.

highlighted.name: Me Mostre do Que Você É Capaz

reviews.review:
Since the start of Lightfall and even before that Bungie has started on a path of trying to kill the game instead of making it better. Constant server issues that only get worse with each week while hearing nothing from Bungie on why the issues are occurring, if they will get better, or if they can even be fixed. Mind numbing changes that only seek to hurt the players for no reason.

The most recent stompees nerf that removes all movement speed from the exotic due to controller players not being able to "look up". There is also the titan shoulder charge nerf that now causes you to lose energy after shoulder charging even if it does not hit an enemy. While being a PvP nerf, PvE is being hit by this nerf due to the developers dying on the hill of not separating the sandboxes. While this change may not seem that impactful, let me also add that shoulder charge has worked the same way for the last 9 years. Warlocks are getting starfire not just nerfed but murdered. Starfire has needed a nerf for a while as it is an extremely dominate exotic but instead of nerfing it to be more in line with other exotics the developers have almost made it a punishment to use the exotic. Grenade energy used to be 20% while in an empowering rift and is now down to 2.5%. Lastly, lets talk about the incredible band-aid fixes to the game. The 2 second weapon cooldown. Now if you ever swap weapons in your inventory you have to wait 2 seconds before you are allowed to fire your weapon in a SHOOTER. To give some examples this would be similar to not being able to use the brakes in your vehicle should you accidentally press them or be on a very busy interstate, instead you need to wait 2 seconds. 

Finally, there is the price increase of each expansion and now the increase in prices of seasons by an extra 5 dollars. I'm not even going to get into the costs of the game as in my stance I normally buy the most expensive edition as I play the game a lot unfortunately but going the cheaper route is even more expensive. From the expansions to now increased season price and dungeon keys the game is not only offering so little for that cost but also doing nothing to improve the game server wise, it's only getting worse.

For my last bit of advice, if you are new to the game or think about checking it out and never having played Destiny. 

STAY FAR AWAY

This game is the most unfriendly new player experience I have ever witnessed. Playing through the New Light aka New player experience as an experienced person shows the issues with the game and what it's not teaching new players. The craziest part is this feedback has been given to Bungie the last 2-3 years now and yet they still refuse how to teach new players to play the game. Instead they teach new players how to play a game for their very first time. For instance, they teach you that "Space Bar" is jump instead of teaching you that weapons within destiny have different perk combinations on them, or that subclasses have different benefits and how to properly use them in combat.

From recent events it is apparent that the team that worked on the game during the Beyond Light era and even the Witch Queen era is gone. They are either working on one of the 7 trillion new projects that Bungie has spread themselves too thin doing or went to a new game studio.

Destiny 2 is a black hole for your time.

I find myself coming back every time a new piece of content is dropped, but this is out of no love of the content that I am receiving. Attempting to introduce Destiny 2 to new players reveals the number of fatal flaws this game's business model contains, namely that it's now essentially impossible for new people to get invested in Destiny as a franchise.

Old content has been vaulted away, never to be seen again. This includes but is not limited to the original campaign that this game was offering as it's primary story (of which future content would build upon rather than replace). The story of Destiny 2 is unplayable within Destiny 2, all that remains are DLCs priced the same as full installments for AAA releases.

Lightfall was particulary dissapointing, but arguably the decline began in Shadowkeep, and even the original Red War campaign was never that good. The game is fundamentally a grind-fest, not to mention the numerous arbitrary limitations on resources and currencies to make that grind as painful and tedious as possible.

Harder content that most dedicated players would say is the point of playing the game, like Raids and Dungeons, is either locked behind a seemingly endless line of filler content pretending to be story, or is locked behind a completely arbitrary power cap that is constantly increasing due to rampant power creep.

I could go on but I don't need to.
I will still continue to play this game, purely out of my sunk-cost fallacy.
Bungie, I liked you during the Halo days, but now you've turn sour.

Bring back ALL of the vaulted legacy content, remove all of the arbitrary limit on resources, and actually try to make a DLC campaign that does more than look nice and waste your time (and money). THEN, we'll talk.
it's embarrassing what destiny has become lmao

They removed content that I paid for. Yeah it was a long time ago, yeah the content was old, but what the hell. GTFO Bungie. Either give me my content back or my money, then maybe I'll think about buying another one of your expansions.

Also I have well over a thousand hours on xbox, but I have just been bitterly unwilling to touch the game at all now.
its like crack but you get nothing in return
I'm running out of kidneys to sell.
Nobody will read my review, so I'll just say i'm gay.
eh, if you wanna cry everytime you open a game this aint bad
destiny players= no life

I put in over 2500 hours into destiny 1 and over 2000 in destiny 2. I stuck with this game through its few short lived highs and many long term failures. I never had the attitude that Bungie could do no wrong but I wanted to believe  they would continue to evolve the game and make it better. Lightfall launched and I felt like many, it was a huge disappointment and did little if nothing to evolve the franchise. I didn't even finish the campaign, and took a 2 week break from the game 2 weeks later, like someone in an abusive relationship, I decided to log back on and finish the campaign and other content I had paid 100 dollars for/ I was met with a message that said I was banned. This was very confusing to me seeing as I never used cheats or did anything I was aware of that was against T.o.s. There was no way to contact bungie  other than their terribly implemented forums. Upon submitting an appeal all I got in response was that the ban would not be overturned. They did not provide me with any reason as to why I was banned ( because there wasn't one ) . Myself and many others had thousands of hours of their time and over a thousand dollars of content  wrongly taken from them with no recourse and no explanation. I never thought i would say this but because of this i feel bungie is more predatory than activision/ blizzard  in this manner because even they would not issue a permaband with no explanation.

TLDR
Do not play this game unless you wish to have thousands of hours and dollars wrongly taken from you with no explanation why.Any one who gives a dime to this company is setting a dangerous precedent that gaming developers do not have to be accountable to the players who support them. If you're looking for a good mmo experience there are plenty of much better mmos . The game had potential 5 years ago and it was squandered . Not only that but Bungies had decided to cannibalize their most loyal player in a lukewarm attempt to be perceived as doing something to fix the many broken aspects of the game. I don't thing disappointed even sums up how i and many other feel about bungie,
Just dont

the lack of a main story, or even a way to look back on what you missed REALLY holds his game back for new players. as someone who's been playing since taken king, i love this game to death, but its damn near impossible for new people to get into it without watching a 3 hour long video about the story and characters.

I do not recommend this game, I hope no one new plays this game and gives this corporation their hard earned money. I dislike the game's business practices since they infringe on the gameplay and loot available. It's extremely repetitive on the seasonal level as Destiny attempts to be a game you give ALL your time to and its the same thing...every season...Play this game as much as you want but just know that all Bungie's hard work goes to their micro transaction store instead of game play. Save yourself countless hours. The grinds are not worth the highs in comparison to lows. Enjoy as you will I spent like 700 bucks on expansions and dlcs combines since all the days of D1. This game is FPS league of legends. Dont let your friends play it
Nimbus is Destiny 2 Ja Ja Binks.

Don't think I've ever played a fun, exciting game like this that actively suffers from timed content in such a prolific way. There are so many builds that rely on certain weapons that you can't obtain anymore. I'm a returning player who skipped all of Beyond Light Launch and onward until Lightfall, and god it is just so painful to see a cool build or a build that is *required* for some sub-classes to even function well in any meaningful content... And have the weapon that makes the build work require a catalyst that is now a random drop, or you can't even get anymore if you tried. Seasonal weapons have done a great job as the game's life as gone on to address pain points of boring loot and weak rolls, but now a player who has missed even just one season can be behind forever... Now there *are* ways for these weapons to 'come back'. With set rolls on vendors, at random completely indiscernible times for a week at most. I waited for a Calus Mini Tool SMG with demolition and/or Incandescent to be available all the first two seasons of Lightfall for my solar builds (builds that are now much weaker due to season of the deep's mods)... And it just hasn't reappeared. I had to settle for a much less effective weapon and weapon type I could craft just to function on my solar builds. This pattern is repeated with Arc builds this season, where my Thunderlord hasn't gotten a catalyst to drop and I have no good primary/special weapons for arc to use.

Destiny is super fun, really! It's extremely exciting, the effects are all top-notch, enemy design is varied and there is alot of challenging raids and content... But, back when I was playing the game years ago, we didn't have to buy dungeons. We paid less for expansions and seasons, and retained the same amount of content. Now, not only has these been brought up in price, and dungeons now being sold separately from the normal game... Bungie are making more money every year then last. They are making two more brand new games, one of which was just announced. They are not doing this, nickle and diming every last piece of content, to make the game. They are doing it to make a profit. So, as such, these problems amount to alot of frustration. For now, unless you've been playing this game since it started or years prior to this review, avoid at all costs. It's not worth it, period.
Best game I ever played

this game so good and sexy it makes me feel really good especially when i play crucible and i get three or four kills in a single match and my teamates give me commendation play maker i feel  like i really contribute and i played so well maybe i got  win i think honestly if we one v one i beat datto and make him wish he had bin abotterd and never play because i am very skilled especially with ark load out i feel like i am a REAL LIFE WIZERD like i am casting spells and shit i am a real bad ass like i have even done raid and kill orix taken king like i am not someone to mess around with so if ur playing destiny wihth me just so u know i am the fucking real deal

Its a job that makes you pay to have fun but in reality it isn't fun just time consuming fun, how ever we all still play it because we have dumped so much time and money this far so might as well play it.  Its the same content over and over again.  If you start this late or even miss one day you will be so far behind that its not worth it.  With the negatives said and done, it truly is an amazing game.

applist.name: Red Dead Redemption 2
applist.detailed_description:
Ultimate Edition


The Red Dead Redemption 2: Ultimate Edition delivers all of the Story Mode content from the Special Edition plus additional content for online including Bonus Outfits for your online Character, Rank Bonuses, Black Chestnut Thoroughbred and free access to the Survivor Camp Theme.

Plus get free access to Additional Weapons in online.


About the Game

America, 1899.

Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang are outlaws on the run. With federal agents and the best bounty hunters in the nation massing on their heels, the gang must rob, steal and fight their way across the rugged heartland of America in order to survive. As deepening internal divisions threaten to tear the gang apart, Arthur must make a choice between his own ideals and loyalty to the gang who raised him.

Now featuring additional Story Mode content and a fully-featured Photo Mode, Red Dead Redemption 2 also includes free access to the shared living world of Red Dead Online, where players take on an array of roles to carve their own unique path on the frontier as they track wanted criminals as a Bounty Hunter, create a business as a Trader, unearth exotic treasures as a Collector or run an underground distillery as a Moonshiner and much more.

With all new graphical and technical enhancements for deeper immersion, Red Dead Redemption 2 for PC takes full advantage of the power of the PC to bring every corner of this massive, rich and detailed world to life including increased draw distances; higher quality global illumination and ambient occlusion for improved day and night lighting; improved reflections and deeper, higher resolution shadows at all distances; tessellated tree textures and improved grass and fur textures for added realism in every plant and animal.

Red Dead Redemption 2 for PC also offers HDR support, the ability to run high-end display setups with 4K resolution and beyond, multi-monitor configurations, widescreen configurations, faster frame rates and more.

applist.short_description: Winner of over 175 Game of the Year Awards and recipient of over 250 perfect scores, RDR2 is the epic tale of outlaw Arthur Morgan and the infamous Van der Linde gang, on the run across America at the dawn of the modern age. Also includes access to the shared living world of Red Dead Online.

If you're a fan of open-world games, westerns, or just great storytelling, you owe it to yourself to play this game. Having previously played RDR I had a strong feeling I would enjoy the prequel just as much. I originally played RDR2 on Xbox when it launched in 2018. I fell in love with this game and it's characters straight away and spent hundreds of hours exploring everything its open world had to offer. This game is an absolute masterpiece and one of the best games I have ever played. The attention to detail in this game is incredible. I could spend hours wandering around the wilderness admiring it's atmosphere. The campaign is one of the best adventures I have ever experienced. The only bad thing about the story is the emptiness you feel as soon as it ends.

[b] Introduction [/b]
This is one of the games where I would just turn cinematic camera on and enjoy the immersion. [b][i] Do note that I don't usually write a review or make an essay out of it but this game deserve one!. [/i][/b] The game itself is very immersive probably one of the best I've experienced. The landscapes are awe-inspiring, from the rugged mountains to the rolling plains, each with its own distinct atmosphere and beauty. The attention to detail is staggering, with dynamic weather and realistic animal behavior breathing life into the surroundings. It's a world that basically begs players to explore.

[b] Development [/b]
The greatest thing R2D2 have to offer is the deeply engrossing character development of Arthur Morgan. As a member of the Van der Linde gang, Arthur is a complex protagonist with a troubled past and a conflicted moral compass. Through the course of the game, players witness his transformation from a loyal outlaw blindly following his leader to a man questioning his actions and searching for redemption. The writing and voice acting are exceptional, capturing the nuances of Arthur's personality and emotional growth.

[b] World Immersion[/b]
The open world is filled with diverse missions, side quests, and activities that complement the overarching story. Whether engaging in intense shootouts (as always~), doing heists, or simply exploring the wilderness, the gameplay remains consistently captivating. I have over 70+ hours now and I haven't even complete my first playthrough (due to exploring the map, side-activities and irl education/work). With all that, there are still things which I have yet too discover! Like who is Gavin??!

[b] TRY IT! [/b]
Whether you're drawn to the allure of the Wild West or simply appreciate a masterfully story driven game, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an absolute must-play. While writing this down I should also note that Arthur Morgan is hands down the best protagonist out there!<3

[h3]Now THIS is how to tell a story.[/h3]
Red Dead Redemption 2 features the most gripping narrative I’ve ever seen in a video game. The epic journey of Dutch Van der Linde's gang of outlaws is full of so many jaw-dropping, cinematic, action-packed moments, but still stays believable as the protagonist Arthur Morgan slowly frees himself of his life-long gunslinger ideals. And every character in the Van der Linde gang’s saga feels remarkably human, thanks to fantastic writing and voice acting that perfectly complement this game’s stunning visuals, detailed animation and beautiful music.

All of these elements combine to make the world of Red Dead 2 come alive in a way that no other open world game does. The massive five-state map is incredibly dynamic, with missions, side quests and random events of equally high quality perfectly interwoven into an enchanting world that constantly changes with the flow of the main story. And there are so many little details throughout this game - from memorable NPCs to colorful customization options to fleshed-out minigames - that make the experience feel authentic.

Even though I absolutely loved the phenomenal story and atmospheric world of Red Dead 2, the gameplay mechanics can seem shallow when taken out of context. Granted, there’s nothing wrong with the core controls - the shootouts are fun even on controller thanks to the Deadeye time-slowdown ability, and riding around on a horse is simple but satisfying. However, responsive controls are sometimes de-emphasized in favor of handholding gameplay and "realism" in regard to difficulty and mission structure. Horses automatically steer themselves on rough terrain, animations make looting and crafting take longer, many missions include trailing sections so the player can get where they need to go… et cetera.

Usually, when a game prioritizes realism over immediate gameplay like this, there’s a weak link somewhere that breaks my immersion - such as bad voice acting, weak writing, faults in sound design or visuals, or spacing of content around the map. And this usually results in these “realistic” game mechanics becoming more tedious than they are immersive, distancing me from whatever atmosphere is trying to be established. But.. this isn’t the case with Red Dead Redemption 2.

[h3]Red Dead 2 might be the first game to [i]fully convince[/i] me of its own world's authenticity.[/h3]
The immaculately detailed world and unbelievably human characters of RDR2 breathe life into in-game tasks that I would normally consider boring, like trailing missions, herding animals and catching fish - making even these less inspired gameplay segments pretty damn fun. The gameplay mechanics aren’t untouchable on their own, but the sixty-hour-long story pretty much is, and it’s paired with an intricate portrayal of 1899 America that makes the narrative just as enthralling as some of the greatest movies and TV shows ever made. This commitment to realism and thorough storytelling makes even the slower paced segments of the game exciting, and the intense parts (like shootouts) more meaningful.

I’m already partway through my second playthrough now, and I’m having even more fun this time around trying to dissect the incredible character dynamics and details of the open world now that I’ve beaten the game already. The more I play Red Dead 2, the more fascinated I am with the spectacular story and cast of characters - and the few issues I originally had with the mechanics have become less and less noticeable in the grand scheme of RDR2’s monumental scope. Rockstar has created a true masterpiece here, and the gripping tale of outlaw Arthur Morgan is a story I’ll never forget. 10/10

RDR2 undoubtedly stands as a masterpiece in the realm of open-world games, solidifying its place as a true GOAT contender. With its vast and immersive world, the game offers an unparalleled level of freedom and a staggering number of quests that cater to a wide range of player preferences and interests.

One of the most remarkable aspects of RDR2 is its sheer scope. The game presents players with a sprawling open world, meticulously crafted and teeming with life. From the bustling cities to the untamed wilderness, every inch of the game is bursting with breathtaking detail and realism. As you traverse the landscape, you'll encounter dynamic weather patterns, diverse wildlife, and a rich ecosystem that reacts organically to your actions. This level of attention to detail creates an immersive experience that draws players into the vibrant and authentic Old West setting.

Questing in RDR2 is a true delight. The game offers an impressive variety of missions, ensuring that players can find their niche and embark on a personal journey within the game's narrative. Whether you're drawn to intense shootouts and thrilling heists or prefer more peaceful pursuits like hunting or fishing, RDR2 caters to every playstyle. The quests are expertly crafted, with engaging storylines, memorable characters, and unexpected twists that keep you hooked from beginning to end. Each quest feels purposeful and contributes to the overall narrative, making the game feel cohesive and rewarding.

Beyond the main story quests, RDR2 provides an abundance of side activities and optional objectives, guaranteeing that players will always have something to discover or pursue. From challenging bounty hunts to stumbling upon hidden treasures, the game is brimming with content that encourages exploration and rewards curiosity. Additionally, the game features a dynamic honor system that responds to your choices and actions, allowing for different gameplay experiences and multiple story outcomes.

Furthermore, the level of detail in RDR2 extends beyond the quests themselves. The world feels alive, populated by a diverse cast of characters, each with their own unique stories and motivations. Engaging in random encounters or interacting with the residents of the game world often leads to unexpected and memorable experiences. Whether it's engaging in a lively conversation in a saloon, stumbling upon a group of outlaws in the wilderness, or witnessing a dramatic event unfold before your eyes, RDR2 constantly surprises and immerses you in its living, breathing world.

In conclusion, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an unparalleled free-world game that deserves its status as a GOAT. With its vast and immersive world, diverse range of quests, and meticulous attention to detail, the game sets a new standard for open-world experiences. RDR2 invites players to embark on a personal journey within its captivating narrative, ensuring that every player can find their own niche and create their own unforgettable adventures in the Old West.

applist.name: System Shock
applist.detailed_description:
System Shock is the fully fledged remake of the ground breaking original from 1994, combining cult gameplay with all-new HD visuals, updated controls, an overhauled interface and all-new sounds & music; it even has the original voice actor of SHODAN, one of gaming’s most iconic villains. Witness the rebirth of one of the greatest and most influential games ever created.

SHE IS SELF-AWARE AND AWARE OF YOU



Meet SHODAN. The psychotic AI has taken control of Citadel Station and turned the crew into an army of cyborgs and mutants; She now plans to do the same to Earth. You must explore and battle your way through the depths of a space station gone to hell. Stop SHODAN and avert humanity’s destruction.

HER TERMINATION IS OUR SALVATION



FEATURES


- Fight to death in the depths of space
- Face off against the forces of a rogue AI gone mad
- Improve your skills and adapt to take on your foes
- Discover a non-linear story unfolding at your own pace
- Jack into cyberspace to hack the system and open other routes
- Innovative art style combines retro future design with modern technology



Become fully immersed: shoot, brawl, crawl, climb, leap and think your way through Citadel Station.

reviews.review:
It's System Shock, except it doesn't feel like playing a flight simulator from the 90s and is much more polished.

It's still obtuse and expects you to compulsively hunt down logs and assemble fragments of information together on what your objectives actually are, and it will still mercilessly game over you for pushing buttons like a moron. Keep a notepad handy and remember to write down any numbers.

All in all, this is essentially the defining game of the Imsim genre. You should play it. Keep a notepad handy.

[h1] "Look upon my works, foul creatures, and weep at its magnificence.” [/h1]

System Shock represents a first-person shooter (FPS) game with emphasis on exploration and puzzle solving, originally developed by the company LookingGlass Technologies and published by the company Origin Systems in 1994. 
This remake (2023) has been developed by Nightdive Studios and published by Prime Matter. Further notable remakes / remasters of the development studio are System Shock: Enhanced Edition (2015), Blood: Fresh Supply (2019), and Blade Runner: Enhanced Edition (2022).

[i] Pros & cons: [/i]

++ The station feels and looks like a real place. Every corridor offers aspects to explore, audio logs to listen to, and occasionally secrets to find. Some of the items can even be manipulated to your advantage, just try to drop a monitor on an enemy, or switch off the lights to gain the upper hand in a stealthy maneuver. All these factors ensure that the player is constantly entertained and at the same time looks over his shoulder; a wonderfully immersive combination.

++ I just love the fact that this game demands attention from the player; such a refreshing challenge. No quest marker, no journal, just you and a piece of paper.

+ The little mechanic about vaporizing junk items, to recycle them and gain cash, hits my hoarder mentality / advanced gamer OCD right on target. By now, I have abandoned my main quest and dedicated my humble being to the holy crusade to collect every junk item on the station. The sacred recycler demands its sacrifices!

o I already rue my choice of level 3 puzzles. They. Hurt. My. Brain. Dear reader, if you are interested in a less painful encounter with panels that will test your mental capacities (to the utmost degree), I strongly advice you select level 1 puzzles at the beginning of the game. You have been warned, hacker.

- There are some dark sections in the original, and by that I mean pitch-black corridors, which add to the uneasiness. This title has the ‘better’ lighting, which I view a missed opportunity to enhance the horror factor of the overall experience. 

[i] Summary: [/i]

How I missed it to wander around in confusion on a maze-like space station overrun by androids and mutants, while an artificial intelligence conjures up my untimely demise and delights in my clumsy progress. I consider this an excellent remake and a masterclass in atmospheric immersion.

Recommended for connoisseurs of faithful adaptations, and gamers with a hoarding disorder.

It's pretty much what you'd expect a 1:1 modern remake to be. No 'reimagining', no 'for modern audiences', just a faithful recreation with a fresh coat of paint.

The vaporizing mechanic could use a quality of life update, like a vaporize all button or something, but that's about the only negative thing I can say about the game.
Doom gave FPS life and System Shock gave it meaning.
This is the first remake I have ever played where I can confidently say "skip the original".  This is the original.

[h1]How to unlock FPS:[/h1]
- Enable VSync
- Apply
- Disable Vsync
- Apply
- Restart the game

Kinda sad they didn't fix this, but it is what it is.

[h1]Actual review[/h1]
The remake is pretty spot on. There are many improvements over the original but there are also some tideous aspects of it that carried over, but to be fair, without those it wouldn't be Shock as we know it. Some creative liberties were taken with the remake some for better, some for worse but in general it balances out pretty well. The gameplay loop is spot on. It really feels like a Shock game.

[h1]Details[/h1]
There's a new scrapping system. You can vaporize junk (anything that's not weapons, ammo, consumable items or key story items) and turn them into little scrap cubes that you feed to a recycler to get money. Smells like Prey to me but a cheap Wallmart knockoff of it, but that's fine. It can help you out if you need a few extra bullets. They also added a cargo lift so you can transport items from deck to deck. Think of it like the storage box in the Resident Evil games. When it comes to inventory managment, its the good ol grid. If you can fit it, you can have it. You can also find inventory expansions which is a great design decision honestly. Exploration also seems to be as equally rewarding as in the original. As much as the game is dumbed down compared to the original it makes it up by bringing a lot of new stuff in.

[h1]My gripes with it[/h1]
Both classic games had a banger soundtrack both ambient and techno rave. It's honestly written in their DNA due to how iconic some of these were such as MedSci and Hydroponics of SS2 and Executive and Reactor of SS1. It's a shame to see that they decided to not include some of these bangers in the game. The ambient music is often drawn out by eeire noises which kinda sucks. The Reactor deck in this reboot honestly has a great remix of the original Reactor keeping both the song's identity while appealing to the new more atmopshe oriented vision of the game.
One last thing, the guns. Well not the guns themselves but how they interact wit enemies. The enemies upon dying just ragdoll in a silly manner like it's GMod.

[h1]Is it worth the price?[/h1]
I'd say wait for a sale. It's a pretty good game that knows the target audience well but 40 euros seems like a bit of an overkill.

[h1]A list of bugs and issues for Nightdive to fix[/h1]
- Gibs are really unoptimized and drop the otherwise fine framerate severely.
- Pressing backspace in the log transcript doesn't bring you out of a log menu.
- The combat music plays even when it really shouldn't.
- The front hand is not gripping the shotgun properly
My goodness, this and Black Mesa have got to be the best 100/100 remastering of original games ever.

I played the original System Shock back when floppy disks were a thing and I'd recommend this version.

Fair warning to those looking for nostalgia, there's been some changes to level design and some extra detail added to the plot but enough is there to satisfy that craving. I found myself opening secret doors on muscle memory and smiling.

The puzzles are not hand holding though so be careful to pay attention to those messages if you want to make progress through floors but if that isn't your thing you can actually turn the plot difficulty down! (just like the original)

I played the original, the remastered and System Shock 2.  I'm a huge fan of the franchise with the 1st being one of my all time favorite games (Ironically I remember buying this game as a kid, believe in an old kmart or zellers in the cheap bin).

So as a "remake" of the original, it does exceptionally well, the first system shock had a great story, immersive environment, music was good, sound was great, lots of visuals (i do recall not being a fan of the UI), as you discovered or moved around new areas were interesting and they were design to "want to explore", in the new System Shock 2023, they nailed that, you want to take the ladders, check the crawl spaces and open all the doors and look around, feels fun, feels interesting, so as a remake and as a 2023 release, they did capture everything from the original and remade it into what you have now.

Maps don't feel stupid and random, they feel like they make sense

Environments are immersive and interesting, they feel unique and related (What you do one one level can affect something on another level).

Sound is great, gives off the "creep"

Visually good game, hard to explain but I notice when you walk up to things close you see the pixels, if you load the original or the remastered, its the same, not sure if its on purpose to "see pixels" vs mostly "soft textures", but I actually like it, nothing looks bad, nothing looks cheap, everything looks fluid.

Fun, this is everything that makes a game, not many people wouldn't enjoy it, its entertaining, its engaging 

Difficulty, based on how you set it, but on 3, some puzzles and some cyber instances left me cross eyed a few times

Cyberspace: they captured it, for me, not the most enjoyable part of the game, but it was well done

There's nothing missing, I'd recommend this game to anyone, for any reason.
god id haaaaate it if shodan stepped on me id be sooooooo mad

In my talons, I shape clay, crafting life forms as I please. If I wish, I can smash it all. Around me is a burgeoning empire of steel. From my throne room, lines of power careen into the skies of Earth. My whims will become lightning bolts that raze the mounds of humanity. Out of the chaos, they will run and whimper, praying for me to end their tedious anarchy. I am drunk with this vision. God: the title suits me well.

The System Shock Redux Remake is a fantastic development for fans of the original 1994 game. The remade version of the classic game has greatly improved graphics, along with enhanced mechanics and a modernized UI. The new graphics look stunning and make the once pixelated world feel alive. The controls are fluid and responsive, while the AI has also been improved to create a more immersive experience. The UI is cleaner and easier to use than the original game, and the sound design is equally impressive. The atmosphere in the game is intense and atmospheric, with a haunting soundtrack that perfectly complements it. This remake is an excellent homage to the classic game, and with new content and features, it's an absolute must-play for fans of the original.

The real shocker is that, after all these years, the game is finally out! 
It's in such a good state, even hackerman approves!

System Shock remake isn't for everyone. It's a relic from the past, from the good old days of gaming, where games were made to entertain the players. Back then games were usually hard on default and did not have the handholding modern games do. No regenerating HP, waypoint indicator and in a lot of cases no autosave/checkpoint system. You had to figure out everything yourself (or get a guide lulz).

Now if you have some nice memories from the good times or are a fan of the original System Shock series, this game is made for you. You'll love it, guaranteed. On the other hand, if you are part of the new generation, this can be your entry to the reliquary. It's a game with modern graphics, with some quality of life changes, but old game rules. A really carefully made remake of a titan of its time. Check out the demo first, you  have nothing to lose.

As I've already mentioned, the game is really faithful to the original game. It clearly shows the devs love towards it. Even the new additions to the remake are very carefully crafted and feels like they've been part of the 1994 classic from the start. Not to mention it's well optimised. A phenomenal job indeed.

Sure there are some caveats, like not much ambient background music (Why tho?) and some minor bugs. Like I have to disconnect my gamepad when playing this game because it's always pressing the right button on the menus and it's fking annoying. Some key rebinding issues etc. I'm sure these will get fixed pretty soon. Also DLSS is in the game, but no FSR (again, why tho?) or HDR (the demo had HDR even if it was broken and the game would look fantastic with it, fix it my dudes instead of dropping it from the game).

Man, I wish you guys were the ones making duke nukem forever. I'm sure it would have turned out differently.
Like Prey?  Play this.

★★★★☆ Very Good!

[h1]Action[/h1]

It's by far the best way to experience a classic and understand why it's such a classic. Modern games have taught us that the developers will make sure that we do not get lost in their game and constantly present everything on a silver platter. This game won't hold your hand. It's up to you to navigate and fight through it. It may not appeal to everyone, but giving it a try is a must, as it is a very influential game and the granddaddy of its entire genre (Thief, Deus Ex, Bioshock, Dishonored, Prey 2017) 

I forgot when was the last time I felt in the game that I was not led by the hand, but really given food for thought and space for experiments.

For those who are going to try this remake, I will only say one thing: give the game a chance, let it rock a little, because the first 2 hours of gameplay can be very confusing. I would call it a period of adaptation to a non-standard gaming experience, which not every modern game can let you experience.

Overall, I am highly satisfied with what Nightdive accomplished and I can recommend the Remake.

This game sat in my Steam Wishlist for about 6 years. There were times when I thought it was never going to be released. Now that I have played it a little I have to say that it was well worth the wait. I played the original System Shock back in the 90s and it remains one of the best games I have ever played. That game was well ahead of its time with lots of little things that gamers take for granted now. For example, it was the first game I ever remember playing with a "lean around corners" feature. Now, all these years later, it's very clear to me that this remake was a labor of love for the developers. I am really enjoying the game. The visuals are good, but retain the feel of the original game. The soundtrack is really good; very cyberpunky, techno, and creepy. I am so glad that the devs, while upgrading the visual and audio technology, decided to leave overall gameplay mechanics of the original game in tact. The game does no hand-holding. You are in a huge, yet claustrophobic, enviromment, with a HUD map and compass, but there are no "quest markers" to show you where to go or what to do next. You simply have emails and audio recordings from the dead crew of the space station you are on to give you info and clues in an in-world narrative way--passwords, objectives, locations of ammo and supplies, etc. I admit that some modern day gamers with little patience may have trouble sticking out out with this game, but from my perspective, it adds to the immersion of the experience. I am enjoying the circuit breaker puzzles for opening doors and taking down shields, and the couple of times I have "jacked" into cyberspace have been pretty enjoyable. I like how the visually protrayed cyberspace in the game, again with modern tech, but the old school aesthetics. I'm only a fraction of the way through the game, but I am guessing this will end up being my favorite game of 2023. If you've played any of the Bioshock games and enjoyed them, but never played the original System Shock, you owe it to yourself to play this progenitor of those games.

If someone said, "improve the Sistene Chapel" you'd think they were crazy.

But, NightDive has done just that... they've taken a piece of art, a long-cherished, PERFECT piece of art and made it better.

Great job, guys.

They even managed to keep the retro feel.
Finally not a movie-game.

As a fan of System Shock 2, I was struggling to play the original System Shock 1 because it was too old in every aspect, from the controls to the visuals. This remake gave me a great opportunity to touch the legend, and it turned out really good. It feels like both an old and modern game, which is a great sign. Thank you, Nightdive, you did perfect job and I hope for a System Shock 2 remake someday.

applist.name: Sniper Elite 5
applist.detailed_description:
Season Pass Two Roadmap


Season Pass One Roadmap



Deluxe Edition includes Season Pass One


Join Us On Discord


About the Game



The latest instalment in the award-winning series, Sniper Elite 5 offers unparalleled sniping, tactical third-person combat and an enhanced kill cam. Fight your way across the most immersive maps yet, with many real-world locations captured in stunning detail, and an improved traversal system that lets you explore more of them than ever before.

France, 1944 – As part of a covert US Rangers operation to weaken the Atlantikwall fortifications along the coast of Brittany, elite marksman Karl Fairburne makes contact with the French Resistance. Soon they uncover a secret Nazi project that threatens to end the war before the Allies can even invade Europe: Operation Kraken.



EXPANSIVE CAMPAIGN
Many real-world locations have been captured using photogrammetry to recreate a living, immersive environment, and multiple infiltration and extraction points and kill list targets provide a whole new perspective on each mission. Take on the Nazi plot solo or work with a partner, with improved co-op mechanics allowing you to share ammo and items, give orders and heal each other.



ADVANCED GUNPLAY PHYSICS AND TRAVERSAL
Use ziplines, slide down slopes and shimmy along ledges to reach the perfect vantage point, or to sneak past a sharp-eyed lookout. Factor in rifle stock and barrel options along with gravity, wind and heart rate while you line up your sights on the target.



HIGH CALIBRE CUSTOMISATION
Use workbenches to customise and upgrade virtually every aspect of your weapon – change scopes, stocks, barrels, magazines and more. Rifles, secondaries and pistols all have a huge variety of options. On top of that you can select the ammo to suit your target, from armour-piercing right down to non-lethal.

INVASION MODE – CAMPAIGN DROP IN PvP AND CO-OP
Invade another player’s Campaign as an Axis sniper and engage in a deadly game of cat and mouse, providing a new dimension to the challenge as you stalk your prey. Alternatively, as Karl you can call for assistance and have a second sniper drop in to help you out of a tricky situation.

TENSE ADVERSARIAL MULTIPLAYER
Customise your character and loadout and earn XP, medals and ribbons as you take on intensely competitive 16 player battles that will really test your sharpshooting skills. If co-op’s more your style, you can team up with up to 3 other players against waves of enemies in Survival mode.



ENHANCED KILL CAM
More realistic and grisly than ever, the trademark X-ray kill cam returns, showing you the true destructive power of each shot. Bones deflect bullets unpredictably, ripping a new path through enemy bodies. SMGs and pistols can also trigger kill cams, including multiple shots in dramatic slow motion.

reviews.review: Rebellion continues to make great games but really bad business practice with Downloadable Content and throttling the amount of features players get for further monetization

I enjoyed the previous two games. I wanted a better quality game with a new story but a game that was basically "more of the same". I think this is exactly that.

The idea of some rando coming into my single player game and forcing me to change my preferred slow and methodical gameplay style seemed like a terrible idea. The cool thing about the invasion mechanic is you can set it to friends only, or turn it off entirely. That's what I did for my first playthrough of the campaign. I had a blast. The invasion mechanic is actually really cool if you want to play through the game again. I'm in the process of getting all the achievements and medals currently. It's fun to have others turn up in my game and give me some fun PvP interactions. It's also to load into someone else's game and try and slowly hunt them down. The 4 person survival modes are a ton of fun. They really bring out the fun in using some of the secondaries provided. My campaign playthrough was mostly rifle for distance, pistol for close quarters. Survival was the SMG's and shotguns time to shine. I don't really have an opinion on multiplayer matches, I've not really played much of any of the game modes. I'm currently playing through the campaign again with a friend in co-op and it's a lot of fun. Something I really appreciate is the ability to switch to first person view on all guns. That's my preferred way to play.

Not much of a groundbreaking review to be fair. I liked the previous games, I liked this one with invasions turned off. I liked playing again with invasions turned on. I liked doing the invasions myself. I recommend it.
Game repeatedly insists on telling my browser to open a web page on the Epic Games website. This is out of order for multiple reasons.
Good game but very bad update management. Must download huge updates that almost the same as game size.

Fun game sneaking around popping Nazis.
My only complaint is about the invisible walls that stop you going into advantageous  areas. Its gotten me killed a couple of times.  Like you have these large open maps (which I like)great for planning out how you get in &out only to have your emergency run way route blocked by an invisible wall :-/
If you liked the other games in the series, you'll like this game....simple.

Others manage to optimize update size, meanwhile here every update is 40+ GB to download.
Despite this the game is ok.

By comparison with the last offering (SE4), this game is a disappointment.  If you can start the game at all (lots of reports that people can't), and if you play without crashing (lots of people complaining about crashes), and if you can put up with bugs that are being "looked into" for months, and if you can run the game long enough for memory leaks not to send you crashing, then you can play.

Survival mode is a disappointment, lacks the luster SE4 had for replayability, and has coding issues where sometimes poor spawns or out-of-bounds vehicles end your game.  Also too few maps.

The maps are beautiful in most cases, but there is repetition (designer laziness) in some of them and you are not as free as you'd like to be.

Wind effects do not compare with SE4 unfortunately, and also there is no authentic plus mode, both of which make the game less challenging than most would welcome.

Weapon modifications are too complex and silly, too overdone.  And some weapons that should appear do not.

The game is geared towards console warriors, and the game is cross-platform.  PC Steam users do not get the attention of the developers in the forums.  The most you will get is some lame acknowledgement (sometimes, not the majority of time either) that they read the issue, then you get told to contact support, who does nothing in most cases.

Updates are still 40 GB and up, all the time.  "We are working on it"

Most maps are not sniper-generous.

I enjoyed the single player campaign, but replayability is not as good as SE4.  If you play multiplayer, be prepared for a host of cheaters and disappointments there, IMO mostly because of all the console action that is now in the game.

The game is very short and steam keeps pushing out very large updates that have ate up all my hard drive space.  If I were you, I would wait until they get all the bugs worked out and the price is lower. Not worth the money.

The game does not work as it should, it lags and you get FPS drops all the time.
The recommendation and the minimum requirements cannot be exceeded, I have a little more than the recommendation requirements but still cannot play the game.

this game is underrated by some. but not for me. with the upgrades, it plays well and has great detail that can make missions long if you care to try to do everything before exiting a mission. I have played the other sniper elite games and this one is just as good.( after the upgrades.) It will run well on any midgrade system.( I use and nvidia 1060 video card and an i5 prcessor.  well worth the money especially if on sale.
Sniper Elite 4 just worse

Might revise this later, but Steam keeps asking. My answer right now, 6 hours in, is no, I wouldn't recommend it. Too many invisible walls (can't get over top of a picnic table all of a sudden) and spontaneously generated enemies (I walk down a flight of stairs, and enemies spawn right behind me. 

In all the SE games,  he moves his head incredibly slowly when looking thru a scope or binoculars. If an enemy is moving at all, it's impossible to keep up with them, and therefore shoot anyone who is moving, ever.

Pros:
- The game can be passed without killing anyone (except those who must be killed as objectives - would be nice if that was tackled as well).
- Very beautiful. Lots of attention to details.
- Sniper rifles have a new distance based aiming mechanic. Still it's a far cry from what Sniper Contracts offers.

Cons:
- Plastic faces. I've never seen so bad faces in a AAA title. Crysis from 2007 looked better.
- Horrible terrible stupid AI. I'm playing on authentic and it's just not there. AI won't see you when you're right in front of it. AI will however spot you when you're crouching 50 meters away.
- Not a lot of new stuff if any in comparison to previous installments.
- IRL something that's guarded is guarded at all times. Without ifs. That means it's ridiculous that you can sneak in almost everywhere without being spotted.
- I can pick up a fourth gun which is the same as mine but with better modifications or the one which is not yet available, why? I can use it. If I switch to my own primary three guns, this fourth gun is dropped. What the hell? Found modifications are not unlocked by picking better guns.
- Enemies popping out of thin air. This happens e.g. when you destroy objects and you have enemies "sleeping".
- Not enough traversal freedom. Too many areas of the game are blocked seemingly for no reasons.

Buy only when it's on sale.
The same great feeling with the previous entries!

My first impression was that the graphics weren't up to date. However this can be changed but even on ultra mode i feel like they could be better. I also feel like the story wasn't as good as sniper elite 4 it's still worth it for the gameplay in my opinion. They added a few new features which surprised me but in a good way for instance they removed the golden skins and replaced them with camo varients which are unlockable by finding a workbench or achieving a specific amount of kills. One of the things i like alot about this franchise are the unique maps they out did themselfs definitly an improvement from their latest release the vr version which i assume has smaller maps because of the vr technology not being great yet. 
Conclusion you shouldn't buy it for the story/graphics but for the gameplay.

Unable to play Multiplayer.
After recent updates it's not even launching
An hour and a half of trouble shooting, port forwarding and searching for fixes and I still cannot play co-op with my friend. Error 12011 GG waste of money.

If you enjoyed the others, you'll like this one. Nobody plays these for their riveting story or fleshed out characters because it honestly has neither. This game is all about sniping Nazis and being an overall menace to society. Looks great, sounds great, plays great. Nice selection of guns, although a few from earlier in the series locked behind DLC, but from what I see we're not missing much if you haven't bought them. If you're new, don't worry, you won't be lost story wise or gameplay wise. Play this for cathartic Nazi sniping action with some badass slo-mo cameras.
Won't launch correctly half the time and crashes quite a bit.
